intro: Levieria parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved levieria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its small, narrow leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Levieria parvifolia is often found in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
